name: Fleeting Seasons
description:
Tutorial

Your kingdom begins with only a Town Hall. Protect and upgrade this building to win the game.

Resources

Your first goal is to secure your resources.  Generating a healthy supply is necessary to survive.

  • Villagers
    • Without villagers your kingdom will fall.
    • Build Houses to bolster their numbers.
    • Consumes Food every Season.
  • Food
    • Required to keep your Villagers alive.
    • Build Farms and Pastures to support your Villagers.
    • Build Silos to store more Food.
  • Materials 
    • Most buildings require Materials to build or upgrade.
    • Use the Destroy tool to harvest the resources from Trees and Stones.
    • Build Guilds to gain materials over time from adjacent Trees and Stones.
    • Build Storage to store more Materials.
  • Wealth
    • Most buildings consume wealth over time.
    • Build Markets to generate Wealth.
    • Build Banks to store more Wealth.
Defenses

Eventually enemies will come to attack your kingdom, and it's important that you be prepared before they come.

  • Town Hall
    • Upgrade this building to unlock higher tiers of buildings.
    • Upgrading to the final level is the ultimate goal of the game.
    • Should town hall fall, your kingdom falls with it.
  • Walls
    • A cheap way to defend or expand your city.
  • Barrack
    • Targets and kills the first enemy that enters its range.
    • Cannot attack more than one enemy at a time, so build multiple barracks for maximum effectiveness.
    • Upgrade to unlock new features.
      • Hunter Lodges will harvest Food from slain Wolves.
      • Military Camps will claim Wealth from slain Barbarians.
Seasons
  • Spring reduces Wealth.
  • Summer reduces Villagers.
  • Autumn reduces Materials.
  • Winter reduces Food.
    How long will it take you to build your Utopia?

    Or will your city fall in the process. In our city building / tower defense game, you will fight through the quickly fleeting seasons to build the most powerful kingdom. Race to build you the strongest kingdom, or see how long you can survive before the seasons and roaming hoards are able to take you down.

    We recommend you take the first game to read the tool tips to understand how the each building works.
